content: The patient is a right‑hand dominant retiree who reports bilateral hand numbness and tingling that began in January 2025 without any trauma, injury, or injection. The symptoms initially woke her from sleep, and more recently she has been wearing night braces, which have helped. She denies pain and limited motion and presents today for evaluation and treatment of these symptoms.
title: HPI Spencer

content: On exam , bilateral upper extremity skin is clearer intact withoutnosis , minimal site tissue swelling , minimal tus palpation . title: Musculoskeletal

content: 3 views of the right hand demonstrate variable joint space narrowing throughout the IP joints, most notably, there is joint space narrowing at the thumb MCP joint, and then the left hand variable joint space or out there is severe joint space narrowing at the bus me the carpal joint.
title: Imaging Results

content:
- Bilateral hand numbness and tingling
- Carpal tunnel syndrome
- Medication‑induced peripheral neuropathy
- Variable joint space narrowing of right hand IP joints
- Thumb MCP joint narrowing
- Severe carpal joint narrowing of left hand
title: Assessment

content: Recommend nerve studies. Return to clinic in 6 to 8 weeks for follow up.
title: Plan
